Heap allocation is the allocation of memory on the heap, which is a region of memory used for storing dynamically allocated objects. It is slower and less efficient than stack allocation, but the memory is not automatically deallocated and can be used for as long as the program needs it. Static storage duration is the allocation of memory that persists for the entire lifetime of the program. It is slower and less efficient than stack allocation, but the memory is not automatically deallocated and can be used for as long as the program needs it.
